notes.text:
An update for .NET 6.0 is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
.NET is a managed-software framework. It implements a subset of the .NET framework APIs and several new APIs, and it includes a CLR implementation.

New versions of .NET that address security vulnerabilities are now available. The updated versions are .NET SDK 6.0.103 and .NET Runtime 6.0.3.

Security Fix(es):

* dotnet: ASP.NET Denial of Service via FormPipeReader (CVE-2022-24464)

* dotnet: double parser stack buffer overrun (CVE-2022-24512)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: .NET 6.0 security and bugfix update

notes.text: A flaw was found in .NET Core, related to the FormPipeReader. This issue allows remote unauthenticated attackers to cause a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: dotnet: ASP.NET Denial of Service via FormPipeReader
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: dotnet: ASP.NET Denial of Service via FormPipeReader

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text: A flaw was found in dotnet, where a buffer overrun exists in the double parse routine, which could lead to remote code execution. This flaw allows an attacker to execute code remotely on the system, leading to some system compromise.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: dotnet: double parser stack buffer overrun
notes.title: Vulnerability summary
